attributes.address: Unnamed Road, George Washington National Forest, Covington, VA 24426, USA
attributes.title: Natural Water Spring

attributes.address: Rocky Mountains, San Isabel National Forest, Colorado 81211, USA
attributes.title: Water Source

attributes.description: Burke Distributing ships Coors products to retail outlets throughout the greater Boston area such as Atlas Liquors in Quincy, MA.
attributes.title: Atlas Liquors

attributes.description: After Coors is filled and packaged, the beer is shipped to distributors throughout the nation. In the greater Boston area, Burke Distributing is the exclusive distributor of the Coors brand of beers.
attributes.title: Burke Distributing

attributes.description: Barley is the primary grain used in the production of beer. It provides sugar for fermentation, imparts color, flavor and body to Coors. Coors purchases barley from suppliers in Montana, Idaho, Colorado and Wyoming.
attributes.title: Barley Growers

attributes.description: Hops are one of the four primary ingredients in beer. The flower from the hop bine is used to impart bitterness and flavor to beer. Yakima Valley in Washington is one of the largest growing regions in the US. Hops are grown in Yakima, harvested once a year in late August, processed, packaged and shipped to the two Coors breweries in the US. Coors also purchases hops from growers in Idaho and Oregon.
attributes.title: Hop Growers

attributes.description: KHS Waukesha is the American division of German owned KHS, a renowned manufacturer of filling and packaging equipment for brewery and beverage companies. The company supplies Coors with equipment to fill bottles, cans and kegs as well as labelers and palletizers.
attributes.title: KHS

attributes.description: Founded in the 1970's by Coors Brewing Co to solve a label problem the brewery was facing during packaging, Graphic Packaging International has grown into an international supplier of packaging materials. The company supplies the two Coors breweries with packaging materials.
attributes.title: Graphic Packaging International

attributes.description: Greystone Logistics supplies Coors with pallets for shipping kegs and cases of finished beer throughout the United States.
attributes.title: Greystone Logistics

attributes.description: A joint venture between Coors and Owens-Illinois, this bottle manufacturing plant employs 260 employees and supplies the Golden, Colorado and Shenandoah, Virginia breweries with glass bottles for packaging.
attributes.title: Rocky Mountain Bottle Company

attributes.description: Built in 2007 to service a growing East coast market, Coors Brewery in Shenandoah Valley, Virginia employs over 500 people and can produce up to 7 million barrels of beer annually. Coors Shenandoah is one of the most modern breweries in the world.
attributes.address: 5135 Southeast Side Highway, Elkton, VA 22827, USA
attributes.title: Coors Brewery
Coors Brewery
attributes.address: Ford Street & 13th Street, Golden, CO 80401, USA
attributes.description: Coors Brewery in Golden Colorado is the single largest brewery in the United States. The brewery is capable of producing 22 million barrels of beer annually. That's 682 million gallons or 7.2 billion 12 oz. bottles or cans of beer. The brewery is known for their Coors and Coors Light brands but also produces Blue Moon, Killians and Caffrey's Irish Ale. The brewery sources its hops, barley and water from outside suppliers but grows the yeast used for fermentation at the brewery.

attributes.title: Rocky Mountain Metal Container
attributes.description: Founded in 2003, Rocky Mountain Metal Container is a joint venture between Coors and Ball Metal. RMMC  is the largest producer of aluminum cans in the world. Aluminum cans and bottles are made at RMMC and shipped to Coors in Golden, Colorado and Shenandoah, Virginia for packaging.

attributes.title: Rocky Mountain Metal Container to Coors Brewery

attributes.description: Coors Shenandoah sources its water from a natural spring just 2 miles away from the brewery.
attributes.title: Natural Water Spring to Coors Brewery
